text: Paraguay competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Paraguay entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=3|Ben Hockin |align=left|100 m freestyle |49.95 |43 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |24.23 |39 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |53.78 |37 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|Charles Hockin |align=left|50 m backstroke |25.62 |29 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Renato Prono |align=left|50 m breaststroke |27.80 |30 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:02.28 |44 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Maria Arrua |align=left|50 m backstroke |30.86 |33 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m backstroke |1:07.08 |52 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Paraguay at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
